title: Fix Caching Issue to Ensure Accurate Customer Data in Proposals
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses a bug where generated proposals included incorrect customer details due to outdated data being retrieved from the cache.

### Changes Made
- Updated the caching mechanism to ensure that the most recent customer data is always retrieved.
- Implemented cache invalidation logic to refresh customer data when updates occur.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to verify that the cache now retrieves the latest customer data.
- Performed integration tests to ensure that proposals are generated with accurate customer information.
- Manually tested edge cases where customer data is frequently updated to confirm consistent accuracy.

review_states.comment: Looks great! The fix effectively resolves the caching issue, and the testing strategy ensures that customer data is now accurate in generated proposals. Approved.

- Performed integration tests to ensure that the API Gateway now uses the most recent proposal templates after updates.
- Manually tested the proposal generation process to confirm that errors related to outdated templates are resolved.

review_states.comment: Looks great! The fix effectively addresses the caching issue and the tests provide good coverage. Thanks for the thorough work on this. Approved!

title: Optimize Database Queries to Improve Proposal Generation Speed
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of slow proposal generation due to inefficient database queries. The root cause was identified as unoptimized queries that resulted in long execution times and increased load on the database server.

### Changes Made
- Refactored and optimized the SQL queries used for retrieving historical proposal data.
- Added appropriate indexing to the database tables to enhance query performance.
- Implemented query caching where applicable to reduce redundant database hits.

### Testing
- Conducted performance testing to compare query execution times before and after optimization.
- Verified that proposal generation speed improved significantly without affecting data accuracy.
- Ensured that all existing unit and integration tests pass successfully.

This fix should enhance the overall efficiency of the proposal generation process and reduce the load on the database server.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The optimized queries have significantly improved the proposal generation speed as expected. All tests pass, and the code is clean and well-documented. Approved for merge.

title: Optimize Asynchronous Operations and State Management for Faster Dynamic Content Rendering
summary:
This pull request addresses the issue of slow rendering of dynamic content, which was impacting the proposal creation process. The root cause was identified as inefficient use of asynchronous JavaScript operations and excessive reflows due to improper state management in the frontend framework. 

To resolve this, I optimized the asynchronous operations by implementing more efficient promise handling and reduced unnecessary reflows by improving state management practices. These changes ensure that dynamic content loads and renders more quickly, enhancing the user experience.

The fix was tested by simulating various user scenarios involving dynamic content loading and rendering. Performance metrics were collected to confirm a significant reduction in load times, and user interactions were verified to ensure no regressions occurred.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The optimizations have significantly improved the rendering speed of dynamic content. I have reviewed the code and tested the scenarios, and everything is functioning as expected. Approved for merge.

title: Fix API Rate Limiting to Prevent Proposal Generation Failures
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the issue of intermittent proposal generation failures due to API rate limiting during peak usage times.

### Issue
The API rate limiting was not properly configured, causing throttling and request denials when the system experienced high volumes of requests.

### Changes Made
- Adjusted the API rate limiting configuration to better accommodate high traffic scenarios.
- Implemented a backoff and retry mechanism to handle throttled requests more gracefully.
- Updated logging to provide more detailed information on rate limiting events.

### Testing
- Conducted stress tests simulating peak usage to ensure the new rate limiting configuration handles high volumes without failures.
- Verified that the backoff and retry mechanism successfully retries throttled requests.
- Reviewed logs to confirm improved visibility into rate limiting events.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The updated rate limiting configuration and retry mechanism effectively address the issue. I've reviewed the code and tested the scenarios, and everything works as expected. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Cache Key Mapping to Ensure Correct Customer Data Retrieval
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses a critical issue where proposals were generated with incorrect customer information due to a mismatch in cache keys. The root cause was identified as an error in the cache key generation logic, which resulted in non-unique keys that led to data retrieval errors.

### Changes Made
- Updated the cache key generation logic to ensure that each key uniquely identifies a customer record.
- Refactored the code to include additional parameters in the cache key that are unique to each customer.
- Added unit tests to verify the correctness of the new cache key generation logic.

### Testing
- Conducted unit tests to ensure that the cache keys are now unique and correctly map to the intended customer records.
- Performed integration testing to validate that proposals are generated with the correct customer information.

This fix ensures that the system retrieves and uses the correct customer data, resolving the issue of incorrect proposals.

review_states.comment: Looks great! The changes effectively address the cache key mapping issue, and the tests confirm the fix. Approved for merge.

title: Implement Lazy Loading and Optimize Caching for Media Assets
summary:
This pull request addresses the issue of image and media asset loading delays in proposal previews. The root cause was identified as a lack of lazy loading and inefficient caching strategies, leading to excessive network requests and slow asset retrieval. 

To resolve this, lazy loading has been implemented for images and media assets, ensuring that they are only loaded when they enter the viewport. Additionally, caching strategies have been optimized to reduce unnecessary network requests and improve retrieval times. 

The fix was tested by simulating various network conditions and verifying that images and media assets load efficiently without delays, ensuring a smooth and complete rendering of proposal previews.

review_states.comment: The changes look great! The implementation of lazy loading and improved caching strategies effectively resolves the loading delays. I've tested the fix under different scenarios, and everything works as expected. Approved for merge.

title: Fix IDOR Vulnerability in Proposal URLs with Enhanced Authorization Checks
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability in proposal URLs. The issue was caused by the use of sequential identifiers without proper authorization checks, allowing unauthorized access to proposals by manipulating URL parameters.

### Changes Made
- Implemented authorization middleware to verify user permissions before accessing proposal details.
- Replaced sequential identifiers with UUIDs to make URLs less predictable.
- Updated unit and integration tests to cover new authorization logic and ensure secure access.

### Testing
- Conducted manual testing to verify that unauthorized users cannot access proposals by altering URL parameters.
- Ran automated test suite to ensure all tests pass with the new authorization checks in place.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The implementation effectively addresses the IDOR vulnerability by adding necessary authorization checks and using UUIDs. All tests pass successfully. Approved for merge.
